column4: hello, i have my own bin directory with scripts, i added the dir to enviroment variables, it works correctly, but when i try to run my own command with sudo i get command not found? how could i fix this
'sudo' resets $PATH to the one root has.
usually, I put such "system" binaries to /usr/local/bin.
ok i'll put them to usr local lib.
bin, not lib. lib is for libraries.
Do you have a ~/.profile, or ~/.bash_profile, or ~/.bash_login? (Any of these.)
If yes, does it contain a line saying '. ~/.bashrc' or 'source ~/.bashrc'?
Okay, now does it contain a line saying '. ~/.bashrc' or 'source ~/.bashrc'?
Or, pastebin the entire ~/.profile if you can.
the only line there uncommented is: test -z "$PROFILEREAD" && . /etc/profile || true
thank you, I added the '. ~/.bashrc', now it works.
